question: Question_05_(c)
statement:
You are given a set of 100 data points \emph{(x\textsubscript{n},
y\textsubscript{n})} with \emph{x\textsubscript{n}} increasing.

\textbf{(c)} Suppose instead that you choose to make a least square fit
of the data points to a quadratic polynomial

\[\displaystyle
f(x) = c_0x^2 + c_1x + c_2.\]

Write down the MATLAB/Octave command you would use to calculate the
coefficients, plot the original data points and plot the quadratic fit
(you may assume that vectors $X = [x_1, x_2, \dots, x_N]^T$ and
$Y = [y_1, y_2, \dots, y_N]^T$ have already been defined).
sols:
A= ones(100,1)

for n=1:99

A={[}X.\^{}n A{]};

end

a= A'*A\textbackslash{}A'*Y

plot(X,Y,'or')

hold on

XX=linspace(X(1),X(100),1000);

plot(XX,a(1)*XX.\^{}2+a(2)*XX=C3*ones(1,length(XX)))
